00064   //It (mostly) works with anything that can accept equality and
00065   //ostreamoperators too!
00066   //[[[[[[
00067   class partial_order 
00068   {
00069   public:
00070     partial_order(int arg) : fArg(arg) {}
00071     bool operator<(const partial_order& rhs) const 
00072     {return (this->fArg < rhs.fArg);}
00073     bool operator<(const int i)const 
00074     { return (this->fArg < i);}
00075     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const partial_order& po);
00076   private: 
00077     int fArg;
00078   };
00079   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const partial_order& po)
00080   {
00081     return os << "partial_order(" << po.fArg << ")";
00082   }
00083   //]]]]]]
00084 
00085   template<>template<>
00086   void testobject::test<7>()
00087   {
00088     partial_order a(5);
00089     partial_order b(7);
00090     
00091     ensure_lessthan("object order", a, b);
00092     ensure_lessthan("object-int order", a, 8);
00093   }
